item.title: Reading List
item.description: 2018 That Holy Anarchist: Reflections on Christianity & Anarchism1 by Mark Van Steenwyk 2017 The Righteous Mind: Why Good People are Divided by Politics and Religion by Jonathan Haidt 2016 Racism Without Racists: Color-blind Racism and the Persistence of Racial Inequality in America by Eduardo Bonilla-Silva American Apartheid: Segregation and the Making of the Underclass by Douglas Massey and Nancy Denton American Indian Ethnic Renewal: Politics and the Resurgence of Identity by Joane Nagel

item.title: Six years of graduate college study music and the transition from blog to personal wiki
item.description: Through a series of Reddit posts/comments I stumbled upon Abhinav Tushar’s personal website where he explains the advantages of keeping a personal wiki versus a blog. I’m not going to recite them all here since you can easily find them directly at the source, but I think this post is well-suited for my inaugural wiki-style post. For a long time I’ve wanted to compile a list of music that listened to through grad school while working/writing/studying/programming in part to share this music with others but also to have this list to fall back on myself.
